question: Sir? -- MASTER BRUCE??
answer: I'm not deaf, Alfred. I hear you.

question: I took the liberty of preparing tea. I take it you've been watching the news?
answer: Yeah...lot of crazy people in this world.

question: I should inform you...Christmas is approaching, and we've received our annual solicitation from the Fireman's Toy Fund. If I may inquire...?
answer: Oh, yeah. Watch this.

question: Most ingenious, sir. What exactly it?
answer: What does it look like?

question: To the untrained eye, sir, it looks remarkably like...the skeleton of an umbrella.
answer: Good guess, Alfred. That's exactly right.

question: Splendid, sir, and if I may say, I'm glad you're putting your time to such productive use. Now -- the Toy Fund. Our contribution last year was a half-million dollars...
answer: We can do better than that.

question: Then there's the foster-parents program... the Gotham homeless crusade...
answer: Yeah...the holidays, I guess. Always gets me thinking about... And to tell you the truth, I'm a little -- concerned about Vicki.

question: Miss Vale, sir...?
answer: Yeah. I've been thinking about it lately. Thinking about it a lot... ...and I still can't figure out what to get her for Christmas.

question: Welcome back, Mr. Boniface.
answer: Mr. Frick. Mr. Frack. Our years of planning are about to pay off. I take it they found the money all right? How much have we got left?

question: Let's see -- an initial capitalization of 42 million and change, compounded over thirteen years, at an annual return of just under sixteen percent --
answer: Fine, fine. How much?

question: Seventy-nine million. -- Excluding the sum we buried.
answer: Speaking of burials...

question: Guess what, Alfred. I think I found a present for Bruce.
answer: He won't hear a word of it from me.

question: He's such a nightmare to shop for. -- What do you get him year after year, Alfred?
answer: I find you can't go wrong with surveillance equipment. Let me put this under the tree...

question: Not so fast.
answer: Why, Miss Vale -- !

question: Don't look. It's your present.
answer: What'd you get me? Kareem Abdul-Jabbar?

question: I'm going to give you the happiest Christmas you've ever had. Homeless. I was just down here Tuesday. Seems like there's more every day.
answer: -- Yeah.

question: They're already razing the tenements and SRO's downtown. These people don't have anyplace else to go. If the city starts selling off the park...
answer: -- Yeah. I guess I'll pass on dessert.

question: Bruce, you do a lot more than most people even dream of.
answer: Sure. Comes off the top of my taxes --

question: That's not what I meant.
answer: -- What I "do" doesn't come close to the root of the problem, Vicki. I'm just a Band-Aid. Randall. You remember Vicki. -- How's the construction business?

question: What a pig.
answer: I've known him since he was seven years old. He was a pig then too.

question: Now he wants to gobble up the park... Bruce -- isn't there something you can do about people like that?
answer: What, tie him up with a bat-rope?

question: No, you idiot. I meant you. Bruce.
answer: Nice outfit.

question: Yo. Ricky here. What's the haps?
answer: Well. "Ricky," is it?

question: How'd you know that?
answer: I heard you on the phone. Talking to your girlfriend.

question: Girlfriend? No, no. That was business.
answer: If you've got time for a little pleasure ...maybe you'd like to buy me a drink.

question: Jeez -- they look almost real.
answer: Why wouldn't they be?

question: You'd have to be crazy. Nobody'd wear the real thing to a dive like this.
answer: Oh, they're real, all right. So are these.

question: Thank you, Mr. Frick. Show her in. Ah, Miss Kyle! At last we meet.
answer: At last we meet. -- Pigeons?

question: Yes, they're common birds -- dirty, stupid, unattractive -- but they're very obedient, and they do crap on people's heads. May I?
answer: I've located the others. All but one. I'm surprised you don't catch pneumonia -- !

question: My normal body temperature is ninety-two degrees. Germs find me inhospitable.
answer: I see why they call you the Penguin.

question: It wasn't about the drugs. Whoever it was left thirty kilos sitting on the docks.
answer: What's that he keeps saying?

question: "Murcielago." -- Bat.
answer: Nonsense. That dock looked like a slaughter-house. Batman's never committed murder.

question: Fine welcome. These storm troopers of yours dragged me away from my coming-home party! I'd like to know the meaning of this --
answer: I'd like to know how thirty kilos of pure cocaine wound up concealed in your personal effects.

question: Gordon -- I come from one of the oldest and most influential familles in Gotham. If you plan to accuse me of smuggling drugs, be my guest. I'll have your badge before you leave this room.
answer: Book the son of a bitch.

question: I believe I'm still entitled to a phone call.
answer: Come on! Let's move it! We're an hour behind as it is!! Jesus Christ, that's Bruce Wayne's bimbo! Hold the ball. I wanna hear it crash.

question: It's me, Randall -- Walter Barrett. I want you to call my attorney. That was my shipment they busted up last night.
answer: Jesus, Walter, I -- Why are you calling me??

question: Hmm. It cost me a half a million dollars. You're sure? I guess you'd know. I have some "friends" in the art world. They say that -- for certain hard-to-get items -- you're the one to call. They say for the right price...you could steal Michelangelo off the Sistine Chapel Wall. Oh, I'm not one to judge. I admire people who take what they want. I'm just curious how you do it.
answer: I find that the old methods work best.

question: Hey, what are you doing -- ?
answer: You're very inquisitive. You'll just have to be disciplined.

question: You know, I've...I've never really done this kind of thing before.
answer: I think people should indulge their fantasies. Don't you?

question: Do you want me to wring that creature's neck?
answer: You try it, I'll do the same to you. I saw him, you know.

question: Saw who?
answer: Batman. He was dreamy.

question: Dreamy?!? Are you insane!? My God -- Are you sure it was him? What did he do?
answer: He stood on a roof and watched me. He didn't realize I'd seen him. I don't think he knew quite what to make of me. But he was definitely interested.

question: This scheme of yours is backfiring. We don't need him on our tails. Do you know how much money is at stake here?
answer: Money isn't everything. What's the point if we can't enjoy ourselves?

question: Six-on-one, and he took 'em all out...then vanished into a drainage pipe -- right next to the statue of General Wayne.
answer: My illustrious great-grandfather. Think it's the same kid we heard about?

question: Must be. He reminded me of you.
answer: -- You work for this rag? Your boss is calling for Gordon's resignation -- unless he brings Batman in for questioning... I need a good PR man.

question: That's what happens when you go after the rich and powerful.
answer: Hey, it wasn't me, remember? I am rich and powerful --

question: Maybe it's almost...good. In a weird way. I mean, Shaw, and Barrett -- if people like that were really scared, maybe they'd --
answer: Quiet. I'm looking for a personal ad.

question: Is this some kind of bad joke?
answer: It's her. That cat woman, or whatever she is. "I jumped a bus into Gotham Park hoping you'd follow, but you were too shy..."

question: What does she want -- a date?
answer: She's trying to contact me. Says she's gonna leave me another ad...

question: WHY DID YOU KILL MY STORY?
answer: Close the door. Your story isn't news. With Shaw dead --

question: But the project's still going ahead! If attacking homeless people in the park isn't news, I'd like to know what is --
answer: There's a psycho out there in a mask and cape -- killing off Gotham's most prominent citizens! That's news. I've known Randall Shaw all my life. His family is in mourning. And it just so happens I don't believe in slandering the dead.

question: Mr. Provost -- how much money do you have tied up in the Park Tower project?
answer: Vicki...I'm going to forget you made that remark. For the sake of your job, I suggest you do the same.

question: Sorry to bother you. Bruce -- I'll get right down to it. You knew Shaw and Barrett --
answer: I saw them occasionally. We all sat on the board of the Fluegelheim...

question: Did you have any...dealings with them, or --
answer: No. I never liked the way they did business.

question: The thing is, Bruce, you're all lumped together in the public mind -- the Five Families of Gotham, that sort of thing -- and, uh... Harrison Provost got this in the mail.
answer: Then Batman is behind all this.

question: Batman or a damned good imitation.
answer: Well. He's changed tactics, hasn't he.

question: Shaw, with his high-rises -- Barrett, a druglord, major polluter -- they weren't exactly model citizens. Who knows, it could be some crazy social-conscience kind of thing.
answer: You mean he's going after...the root of the problem.

question: Let me know if you get one of these. We'll put all our resources at your disposal.
answer: Changed my mind, Alfred. I'll be dropping in on the Fluegelheim after all.

question: You two won't be terribly upset if I borrow Bruce for a moment, will you?
answer: I can't imagine why.

question: Tax year's almost over, you know. I hope we can count on your usual generous donation. Someone's got to set an example for those two tightwads.
answer: They're proccupied. This string of murders --

question: I asked them if they'd consider including us in their wills. They didn't seem a bit amused... -- and this is my good friend Bastet, the Egyptian Cat Goddess.
answer: I think we've already met. -- This is quite an expedition you've put together.

question: I'm glad you think so. I have to say, Bruce -- you're not at all what I expected.
answer: Sorry to disappoint you.

question: Oh, it's not that. Not at all. It's just that I'd always heard you were...
answer: What?

question: Oh...sort of a...
answer: No. Come on. What? Oh. Selina Kyle -- my friend Vicki Vale.

question: It was easy. I slept with the Pharoah.
answer: Pull in the claws, okay? She's really terrific.

question: I'm sorry, Bruce. Sometimes I get a little...aggressive, you know? Look, I need to talk to you. Come by sometime. I'll give you the private tour.
answer: Wait. Let me explain about Vicki --

question: He's just another rich idiot. The odd thing is, he didn't seem a bit concerned.
answer: Then he is an idiot.

question: He lives in some big sprawling manor. I'll have to get inside, scope it out... see where he's got the raven stashed.
answer: How do you plan to do that?

question: What have we got here?
answer: Mummified cats. Bastet's sacred animal. They were buried by the thousands at Bubastis. -- Oh, careful!

question: You're in a gruesome line of work.
answer: Keeps me interested. And that's not easy to do...

question: This one I know. It's a gryphon, right?
answer: Very good. A mythical demon, half-bird, half-lion...sweeping down from the sky to deliver retribution and justice.

question: Poor guy. Birds and cats -- you wouldn't think the two halves would cooperate.
answer: Only under certain circumstances. I'm really glad you came, Bruce. I was afraid I'd given you the wrong impression. Or maybe it was the right impression.

question: What was it you wanted to talk to me about?
answer: Your collection. I'd love to see it. I mean, everyone says you've got a fabulous --

question: No.
answer: It must be strange. Having all that power, and money -- never really knowing if that's what people are attracted to.

question: What are you attracted to?
answer: I think you're a little bit nuts. I think you're a little -- bored with your life. Having everything you want. No variety, no...danger. And every once in a while you need to take a risk. Shake it all up.

question: How?
answer: Maybe by...coming here today. Are you okay?

question: Is there a cat in here?
answer: Poor thing. You're allergic!

question: Commissioner Gordon called. He wants to install a full contingent of police guards here at the manor -- in round-the-clock shifts -- to protect you from Batman.
answer: Great. What'd you tell him?

question: I told him that since you were Batman, you'd require no protection from Batman.
answer: Jesus, Alfred -- !!

question: In future, sir...I strongly advise against trying to fly off twenty-story buildings.
answer: It's just a few bruises.

question: One bruise, sir. Which covers your entire body.
answer: I'm getting too old for this line of work. Cops placed me at the scene of the crime -- that weird kid of Vicki's saw my face --

question: I shouldn't worry overmuch. I doubt the two of you move in the same circles.
answer: -- and I got the living shit knocked out of me by a woman.

question: ...Have it analyzed.
answer: Don't worry. I'll bring 'em up with me. We'll open 'em when I get there.

question: Sorry, folks, but we'd better move along.
answer: They'll be safe, won't they?

question: As safe as we can make 'em. It would help if you could give us some small hint what this is all about.
answer: I told you. I...

question: You have no idea what was in that box that Provost had delivered from the bank.
answer: Hello...? Not today, Andy. Let's talk after New Year's.

question: English accents are so stimulating. You have the most beautiful silver hair!
answer: Selina. What are you doing here?

question: I wanted to see your things, remember? And I got tired of waiting for you to call me back. He's adorable. How long have you had him?
answer: You heard about Harry Provost.

question: It's incredibly awful. It got me a little worried. I hate to think of something happening to you.
answer: Same here.

question: It's odd, though. Danger, the thought of suddenly dying -- in a weird way it gets you sort of...aroused. Don't you think? Bruce, this is incredible. Malaysian -- ?
answer: Not bad. Sarawak warrior caste.

question: The police have no files whatsoever on Selina Kyle.
answer: London...Cairo...Belgium...

question: What exactly are you --
answer: Her credit card records. Every major art theft in the last five years -- she's been on the scene or close to it.

question: You mean she's some sort of -- collector? A...cat burglar, or --
answer: Could be. Museum curator, authenticator -- she's got the perfect cover for it. What would she want with that stupid raven?

question: Raven, sir?
answer: That's what the Catwoman took from Provost. A little raven statuette, about so big... But it couldn't have been that valuable.

question: How very odd. I'm sure it's nothing, but --
answer: What, Alfred?

question: Your father had a raven, sir. A small statue of the very sort you describe. It used to sit on his desk.
answer: What happened to it?

question: After your father's...demise, Mr. Tiptree came to the house and asked if he could have it. As a keepsake. I saw no harm... That was thirty years ago.
answer: Wait a minute. Mr. Tiptree?

question: George Tiptree. Your friend Elliott's father.
answer: What are you looking for -- Batarangs?

question: What are you looking for -- Batarangs?
answer: Bruce! Come on up. I want to talk to Mr. Wayne alone.

question: I brought you a Christmas present. Sorry about the wrapping -- the police made me open it.
answer: ...I'm afraid I don't have anything for you.

question: I think you may have something that belonged to my father.
answer: -- You know?

question: What are you talking about? Who?
answer: Batman. I don't know how he found out, but --

question: It's time you told me what's going on here.
answer: Didn't you ever wonder where it came from, Bruce? All the privilege, all the power ...all the money? The ravens are a...a kind of map, Bruce. The key to an incredibly vast fortune.

question: Whose fortune?
answer: Gotham City's. In 1880 the Gotham City Treasury was looted. It was a fantastic operation -- perfect military precision. The robbers made off with milllons in gold and silver bullion... The city was going under. Bankrupt... until five rich men stepped in to bail it out. In exchange they took the land rights, the mineral rights, the service contracts --

question: The Five Families.
answer: Our ancestors. They bought Gotham City -- carved it up and ran it into the ground. In five years they were rich beyond imagining. We've just been following in their footsteps. And in all this time no one's ever suspected --

question: -- that they were the ones behind the robbery?
answer: They had five ravens made. Five ravens which -- combined -- would reveal the location of the treasure they'd stolen. But they never touched it. They never needed to. It's still there to this day. The ravens, and the secret -- have been passed down through generations. Father to son... Your father -- died before he could tell you.

question: So they stole his piece of the puzzle.
answer: Yeah. I've got it, Bruce, and I'm going to hand it over. He's right, you know. We've all been feeding -- feeding on the soul of Gotham... It wasn't his doing, Bruce. It was --

question: That doesn't matter. If he knew that his fortune was based on a crime -- a crime against the city... Reputation or not, he would've tried to --
answer: Christ, Bruce! Do you want me to spell it out for you?!? They killed him...to protect their secret ...and now the bill's come due. Now the bill's come due.

question: According to this, he's directly below us.
answer: The subway, sir?

question: Yeah. Take a right. He's slowed down. Looks like he's under the park.
answer: How do you propose to get down there, sir? We can't have Batman strolling up to buy a token.

question: I've cooperated. I've done everything you said.
answer: Open the case.

question: The other one is Bruce Wayne's. He doesn't know anything about this. You've got what you want. There's no need to --
answer: Thank you, Mr. Tiptree. You may go.

question: My family. You won't --
answer: We'll certainly take your unexpected generosity into consideration.

question: We -- ?!? You're not Batman.
answer: No. I'm his brother-in-law -- Birdman. Now move out.

question: No. I'm his brother-in-law -- Birdman. Now move out.
answer: That idiot. Another six feet --

question: So sorry to spoil your fun. -- He brought two ravens. We've got a complete set!
answer: What??

question: Yeah! They're in the suitcase --
answer: GIVE ME A HAND! God. Did you see him? Isn't he hot?

question: Haven't you got anything else to think about? I'm hot. That was exhausting.
answer: No pain, no gain! -- Suck it up. We're not out of here yet.

question: LETS DO IT! Now. Give each raven a quarter-turn.
answer: What happens now?

question: No, no -- don't try to get up -- you're hurt.
answer: I don't belong here. You can't keep me here.

question: It's "Dick", isn't it? Or do you prefer "Richard"? "R" -- for Richard, right? See, all your things are here... What is it, some kind of gymnast's outfit?
answer: It's none of your business. What is this, some kind of home?

question: No, not that kind. There's a swimming pool -- tennis court -- you can have anything you want.
answer: Tennis court?! -- Lady, you're rich. How the hell would you know what I want? I'm not staying. You can't make me --

question: I can make you.
answer: What do you propose to do with him, sir? Keep him in the room for the rest of his life?

question: I don't know, Alfred. I've got other stuff to worry about.
answer: The child is hurt, sir. At the very least we should attempt to locate his parents.

question: He hasn't got any parents.
answer: How do you know that, sir?

question: ...I know.
answer: Sir -- it's Miss Kyle.

question: She'll be ready for Batman -- but not for me. It's the only way, Alfred. I've got to take her out tonight.
answer: You're early. I'm afraid I'm not quite dressed.

question: Christmas eve. No tree?
answer: No presents. I've been a bad girl this year.

question: I'm surprised you kept this date. I thought you would've lost interest by now.
answer: What makes you say that?

question: You've got what you want, don't you?
answer: I do now. We've had this date for a long, long time.

question: How much is it going to cost me?
answer: What?

question: ...To get the ravens back.
answer: You're the oddest man I've ever met. Let's talk later, Bruce. I've got kind of a short fuse... Did I hurt you? Just relax -- you'll start to enjoy it.

question: What di-- what did you d--
answer: I guess I've...gotten under your skin.

question: The cave. Under the house. How do I get there? Then maybe you'd like to tell me.
answer: You're no more than a common thief.

question: Wrong, you old idiot. I happen to be a very uncommon thief. Are you going to tell me, or does Miss Vale get an early present this year?
answer: I...don't...know...

question: ...and then Batman showed up?
answer: He saved all our lives, Jim. I can't say for sure, but I'd bet she's the one behind the murders.

question: God -- I pray you're right. One thing before we go, Bruce. Who's the kid?
answer: Oh, that's Vicki's little cousin. He's in town for the holidays.
